title: Rationalization (psychology)
summary: In psychology rationalization or rationalisation [an attempt to prove as true or righteous] is a defense mechanism in which an attempt is made to justify [prove true or righteous] controversial behaviors or feelings and explained in a seemingly rational or logical manner in the absence of a true explanation, and are made consciously tolerable—or even admirable and superior—by plausible means.[1] It is also an informal fallacy of reasoning.[2]
